abstract: Gap says it will stop requiring employees to be available for last-minute work shifts; retailer is latest to move away from  'on-call scheduling.'
lead_paragraph: The clothing chain’s five brands — Athleta, Banana Republic, Gap, Intermix and Old Navy — plan to start giving workers 10 to 14 days’ notice of their schedules.

headline.main: Gap Says It Will Phase Out On-Call Scheduling of Employees
headline.print_headline: Gap Says It Will Phase Out On-Call Scheduling of Employees

snippet: The clothing chain’s five brands — Athleta, Banana Republic, Gap, Intermix and Old Navy — plan to start giving workers 10 to 14 days’ notice of their schedules.
